newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Discovery Channel, BBC team up in major venture.
newsitem.headline: Discovery Channel, BBC team up in major venture.

text.p: Discovery Channel said on Thursday it had teamed up with the British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC) in a US$500 million venture to make programmes and launch new channels.

It said in a statement Discovery Communications Inc, the parent of cable television's Discovery Channel, and BBC Worldwide Ltd, the state-owned BBC's commercial arm, would launch new channels in the United States and elsewhere.
The venture would also create hundreds of hours of new programmes, the statement said.
It said Discovery would finance the venture, which would have access to the BBC's vast programme library.
The statement quoted Discovery founder John S. Hendricks, who part-owns the company, as saying: "I can't think of a better partner for what I'm sure will be a very exciting journey."
The statement did not say what kind of programmes the venture would make, but both Discovery Channel and the BBC are strong in wildlife and evironmental programmes.
Discovery Communications is owned by Liberty Media Corp, a division of Tele-Communications Inc, Cox Communications, Advance Newhouse Communications and Hendricks.
